title: Oppo A6t 5G, A6t 4G, and A6t Pro also unveiled
summary: It's been a pretty big day for Oppo's A-series globally, with the introduction of the A6, A6s, and A6x pairs. Last, but definitely not least, we have the A6t trio. Let's start with the A6t Pro. This one comes with a 6.75-inch LCD screen with 720x1570 resolution, 120Hz refresh rate, and 1,125-nit pe…

title: Oppo A6x 5G and A6x 4G make a global debut
summary: Oppo has recently launched the A6s 5G and A6s 4G as well as the A6 5G and A6 4G globally, and they're joined by another pair: the A6x 5G and A6x 4G. The A6x 5G comes with a 6.75-inch 720x1570 LCD screen with 120Hz refresh rate and 1,125-nit peak brightness, the Dimensity 6300 SoC at the helm, a 50M…

title: Golden Globes Hit 8.7 Million Viewers Amid NFL Competition
summary: The 83rd annual Golden Globes reached an average of 8.7 million viewers on Sunday night, which marked the ceremony’s third year in a row of airing on CBS. Measured by Nielsen, that total represents a 6% drop from the 9.3 million viewers reached by the 2025 ceremony — which marked a 2% decrease from…

title: Google Pixel 10a release timeline leaks along with colors and storage options
summary: If you've been patiently waiting for the Google Pixel 10a to hit the streets, you're in luck as apparently you only have around one month left to wait. That is, of course, if the latest rumor pans out. The phone will allegedly be in stores around mid-February. It will be offered in four colorways: …

title: Apple introduces Creator Studio, a subscription bundle of its best creative apps
summary: Today Apple is introducing a new app bundle. It's called Creator Studio and for a fixed monthly or yearly fee, you get access to a bunch of creative apps: Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, and Pixelmator Pro on Macs and iPads, as well as Motion, Compressor, and MainStage on Macs. There are also intelligent…

title: Qwen boss says Chinese AI models have 'less than 20%' chance of leapfrogging Western counterparts —  despite China's $1 billion AI IPO week, capital can't close the gap alone
summary: China’s AI sector made a splash this month as a cluster of domestic AI firms raised more than $1 billion through IPOs in Hong Kong.

title: AMD's next-gen Ryzen AI 400 laptops could launch on January 22, five days ahead of Panther Lake — Gorgon Point release date leaks through early Asus listing in China
summary: AMD announced the Ryzen AI 400 series at CES with a Q1 2026 launch window, but apparently the first laptops in China to feature Gorgon Point are coming as soon as January 22, 2026. An official Asus listing in the region has shown off a new laptop with the Ryzen AI 7 445 inside set to drop in just a…

title: Deepseek research touts memory breakthrough, decoupling compute power and RAM pools to bypass GPU & HBM constraints — Engram conditional memory module commits static knowledge to system RAM
summary: A new Deepseek whitepaper has outlined a new form of long-term memory for AI models, named Engram. Engram-based models are more performant than their MoE counterparts, and decouple compute power from system RAM pools to improve results.

title: DIY PC maker Framework's desktops finally succumb to RAM apocalypse, hit with price increase — now starts at $1,139 with 32GB, 128GB up $450
summary: After raising prices on its memory sticks, Framework is now raising prices on the Framework Desktop, its AMD-based gaming and AI-focused PC.

title: Oppo A6 and A6 5G introduced
summary: The Oppo A6 series continues to expand in numbers and the A6 and A6 5G are the latest entries. The pair features nearly identical specs apart from their chipsets, with the A6 packing the Snapdragon 685 chip while the A6 5G gets the Dimensity 6300. Oppo A6 (left) and A6 5G (right) Both feature huge …

title: Microsoft to overhaul AI data center building with community-first approach —  says it will 'be a good neighbor' to communities, cover energy cost increases, and replenish water
summary: Microsoft's five-point plan focuses on electricity use, water consumption, building local jobs and training people, investing in local infrastructure, and the long-term skills development of the community surrounding its AI data centers.

title: Samsung Galaxy S27 Ultra camera details tipped
summary: The Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra hasn’t even launched yet, but details about its successor, the Galaxy S27 Ultra, are already emerging. The latest leak reveals new information on its camera setup. According to well-known tipster Ice Universe, the Galaxy S27 Ultra will be equipped with an improved main …

title: Nvidia fires back at rumors it will require upfront payment from clients for H200 orders — company says that it ‘would never require customers to pay for products that they do not receive’
summary: Nvidia refutes the claim from some sources that it's requiring Chinese customers to pay for their H200 orders upfront while still awaiting final approval from Beijing.

title: 3D Printing for consumers at CES 2026 — Creality, Snapmaker, AtomForm and Protopasta show their latest systems
summary: The SPARKX i7 earned Tom’s Hardware’s Best 3D Printer award as Creality, Snapmaker, AtomForm, and Protopasta showed how home fabrication continues to evolve alongside AI-driven tech at CES 2026.

title: Oppo Reno15, Reno15 Pro, and Reno15 Pro Mini go on sale in India
summary: The Oppo Reno15 series, announced for India last week, is now available for purchase in the country through Oppo India's official website, Amazon.in, Flipkart, and mainline retail outlets. The lineup includes the Reno15, Reno15 Pro, Reno15 Pro Mini, and Reno15c. The Reno15c will be available in Ind…

title: Australian modder solves PC in a freezer conundrum with sheer size, socks filled with silica gel powder — condensation conquered and minimal overclocking gains on display at minus 28C
summary: Trashbench succeeded where others failed, thanks in large part to the size of his freezer, which helped prevent large temperature swings that cause condensation.

title: Samsung Exynos 2700 chipset details leak
summary: Samsung unveiled the Exynos 2600 SoC just a month ago as the world’s first 2nm mobile chip. While the chipset hasn’t appeared in any phones yet, a new leak has already surfaced revealing details about its successor, the Exynos 2700. A tipster with virtually no track record has shared alleged detail…

title: Grab a premium AM5 motherboard and RAM bundle for just $459 at Newegg — 32GB of Corsair Vengeance DDR5 and ASUS ROG Strix X870-A gets a big discount
summary: Newegg is selling 32GB of Corsair DDR5 and an Asus Rog Strix X870-A motherboard for $459.99.

title: Another Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra case showcases its design
summary: We've already seen the upcoming Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra in a bunch of cases, and today there's another one - already up and listed on its maker's website. Like the others, this showcases the phone's oft-leaked design, basically confirming, yet again, the shape of the camera island - and the fact t…

title: Meta sets up 'Meta Compute' organization for gigawatt-scale AI data centers — initiative is said to consume hundreds of gigawatts over time
summary: Meta establishes 'Meta Compute' organization to manage buildout of next-generation data centers and development of custom computing architectures that will power gigawatt-class data centers.

title: Jensen Huang claims that 'god AI' is a myth — Nvidia chief says 'doomer narrative' is 'extremely hurtful'
summary: Nvidia's Jensen Huang says negative narratives around AI are "extremely hurtful," and that science fiction speculation isn't connected to reality.

title: 42 bewildered Amazon customers duped by $999 RTX 5090 scam, sent fanny packs instead — bait-and-switch deployed by seemingly reputable buyer
summary: An Amazon seller is tricking desperate buyers by offering a fake GeForce RTX 5090 for $999

title: Fully 3D-printed drone capable of flying at 408 mph is the fastest in the world — father-son duo reclaim Guinness World Record title with DIY quadcopter
summary: The Peregreen V4 reclaimed the world’s fastest drone title after pushing past a rival’s 626 kmph record.

title: Nvidia's elusive N1X SoC leaks out again — shipping manifest reveals Dell may have explored putting it on next-gen XPS laptops
summary: Even though the N1 SoCs have never actually been officially unveiled, we do know they exist, as confirmed by even Nvidia's own CEO. However, beyond powering the DGX Spark, we've never seen this silicon make it to market, and Dell's latest laptop might be the closest we've gotten so far to seeing th…

title: Asus ROG Swift PG27AQWP-W 27-inch 540 Hz QHD QD-OLED gaming monitor review: Every piece of performance tech in a single display
summary: Asus puts all the gaming monitor tech in its arsenal into the flagship ROG Swift PG27AQWP-W. It’s a 27-inch QHD QD-OLED panel with 540 Hz, 720 Hz in HD, Adaptive-Sync, DisplayHDR 500 True Black and wide gamut color. This display truly has it all.

title: Retro Apple emulator ported to $60 ESP32 microcontroller-powered touchscreen tablet — supports Mac OS8.1 and a virtual MC68040 CPU in major emulation leap
summary: A new emulator makes running classic Apple Macintosh 68K software a breeze on a cheap, portable, IoT development kit.

title: Asus revised the liquid metal application on its $4,000 ROG Matrix RTX 5090 cards — der8auer says retail versions come with 'much more professional' spread
summary: The retail versions of the ROG Matrix RTX 5090 shipping out to customers will come with an updated TIM application that should help against accidental liquid metal leakage. Previously, sample GPUs showed a poor spread that would barely seal the metal in, with a crooked ring around the core. Now, we…

title: FCC approves 7,500 additional Starlink Gen2 satellites — service will benefit from higher throughput and lower latency worldwide
summary: The FCC has partially approved a significant expansion of SpaceX’s next-generation Starlink constellation, authorizing 7,500 additional LEO satellites under a partial grant.

title: MetalPrinting Gauss MT90 3D printer offers office‑safe metal printing without powders — uses paste based metal extrusion (PME) tech
summary: MetalPrinting was at CES 2026 with its next-generation metal paste 3D printer dubbed the Gauss MT90.

title: Modder saves $130 by building 32GB DDR5 desktop DIMMs from scavenged laptop memory —  donor modules soldered to bare PCB flashed with custom firmware even run XMP
summary: DIY DDR5 is no longer just a concept, but a reality, as modder VIK-on has built his first 32GB stick from scavenged parts. The memory chips came from laptop SODIMMs, while a new PCB and cooler were acquired from China. After flashing custom firmware enabling 6400 MT/s XMP, the entire build put toge…

title: Windows Media Player’s ‘find album information’ functionality has been removed — you’ll have to find other software for playing and ripping CDs with relevant track information
summary: Microsoft has quietly removed ‘find album information’ and ‘update album info online’ tools from the Media Player apps supplied with Windows 11.

title: US Department of Commerce lifts planned crackdown on Chinese drones, including DJI — company gets reprieve ahead of Xi-Trump meeting in April, but the FCC ban still stands
summary: The U.S. Department of Commerce has retracted its proposal to stop the import of DJI drones, but the FCC's ban means that the U.S.'s doors are closed to new DJI models anyway.

title: Nvidia’s Blackwell gaming GPUs go through blower-style transformation to fuel AI data centers — RTX 5080, RTX 5070 Ti, RTX 5060 Ti blower GPUs up for purchase in China
summary: China's underground GPU operations have birthed a few more spectacles, new Nvidia RTX 50-series SKUs with blower-style coolers, aimed at data centers and server farms. Listed on Taobao, the RTX 5080, 5070 Ti, 5060 Ti & more are all priced higher than their retail counterparts, and that's for their …

title: Admins finally get the power to uninstall Microsoft Copilot on Windows 11 Pro, Enterprise, and EDU versions — devices must meet specific conditions to allow the removal of the AI app
summary: Microsoft finally allows administrators to remove the Microsoft Copilot app from managed versions of Windows 11 Pro, Enterprise, and EDU. However, you need to have Microsoft 365 Copilot installed, among other conditions.

title: HP reportedly eyes Chinese suppliers for DRAM as global shortage sparks shake-up — analyst says memory chips are commodities that can easily be replaced
summary: A tech analyst claims that HP told the Bank of America that it's considering buying memory chips from China to help alleviate the ongoing shortage.

title: Steam Machine pricing soars past PS5 Pro and Xbox Series X in new retailer listing — 1TB SKU shatters $1,000 barrier
summary: Czech retailer Smarty has listed Valve’s highly anticipated Steam Machine at $950 for the 512GB version and $1,070 for the 1TB model—both before taxes.

title: Dev creates selection of UEFI games you have to beat in order to boot your computer — 10-month project will shut down your PC if you lose
summary: Dev creates a quintet of UEFI games with the premise of Win -> Boot, Lose -> Shutdown.

title: This $2,000 Bitcoin mining water heater can pay for itself by slashing your energy bills, company claims — can rake in $1,000 a year in BTC, offset 80% of electricity and water costs
summary: Superheat was at CES 2026 to showcase what it describes as “a water heater that pays for itself.” Instead of a resistive heating element, it warms your H2O with heat generated by a Bitcoin ASIC miner.

title: Jensen Huang discusses the economics of inference, power delivery, and more at CES 2026 press Q&A session — 'You sell a chip one time, but when you build software, you maintain it forever'
summary: In a press Q&A at CES 2026, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addressed everything from Rubin’s design philosophy to inference economics, power constraints, open models, and more.

title: Nvidia hires first-ever CMO, snatches former Google exec for the tough job of helping sell more chips — Alison Wagonfield spent nearly 10 years at Google building its Cloud project
summary: As the AI hardware market is about to change, Nvidia is hiring its first chief marketing officer.

title: Intel showed up for consumers at the 'Consumer Electronics Show;' AMD didn’t
summary: At this year's CES, AMD felt like a dominant force, too focused on AI potential to talk about (or to) consumers. Intel looked more like a laser-focused startup, confidently pitching its Panther Lake chips to gamers, laptop users, and even robot makers.

title: Meta inks deals to supply a staggering 6 gigawatts in nuclear power for data center ambitions — enough wattage to supply 5 million homes
summary: The 6GW will come from various suppliers — both existing and upcoming — to deliver the estimated 1GW that Meta's Prometheus site will require in 2026, and the 5GW its Hyperion data center will need by 2028.

title: Researchers turn spoiled milk into 3D printing materials — extracted proteins from dairy waste combined with polymers to create plastic alternative
summary: This work turns what would otherwise be an agricultural liability into a potential input for advanced manufacturing.
